channel.title: Which Radeon card should I get?
channel.description:
I am not sure which of the following video cards I should get. People might say, "Well get the most expensive one! The 9800!", but the 9600 has twice the memory. So anyway, I am in no way an expert on video cards, so could someone help me out here?
[url=http://www.pricerunner.com/computing/components/graphics-cards/210596/details]Radeon 9800 Pro 128mb[/url] = $149.00 [url=http://www.pricerunner.com/computing/components/graphics-cards/106321/details]Radeon 9700 128mb[/url] = $90.68 [url=http://www.pricerunner.com/computing/components/graphics-cards/220838/details]Radeon 9600 Pro 256mb[/url] = $69.90
Note: These are all OEM
(Yes, I did my research. I want an ATI, not an nVidia :P)

item.title: Which Radeon card should I get?
item.dc:creator: @MybJames MybJames
item.description:
@MybJames wrote:

winston005:

if i were you i would go to a local pc place and ask them. a good one not one where they just fix computers one where they know what the hell there talking about (yeah im sure you know what i mean). for ex. instead of mr fix it… go to bobs custom computers. (for all your computer needs)

well the difference is here that we know what we are talking about, and we don’t want to go to some shitty computer store so they can take all of our money.

Read full topic

Get an x800 or x850 for the same price but better. They’re $80 - $130

item.title: Which Radeon card should I get?
item.dc:creator: @DeadBird DeadBird
item.description:
@DeadBird wrote:

[quote=“Hex Key, post:8, topic:65329”]ATI’s R&D department are about 6 months behind nVidias, Do ATI even have any dx10 cards out atm???
Wait a couple of months and you will be able to afford the next wave of cheap nVidia dx10’s when they come.[/quote]
ATI doesn’t have a DX10 card out, but they have one. It’s the r500\Xenos. It won’t be released either

Read full topic

item.title: Which Radeon card should I get?
item.dc:creator: @iamafisher iamafisher
item.description:
@iamafisher wrote:

hey rictoo, no offence but those cards are not nearly high-high-high end. I would say they are lower middle XD

I would suggest nvidia, but if you are going to go for it, get the 9600, reason being, more memory, so you get to play with higher graphical settings in your games.

Read full topic
item.source: Which Radeon card should I get?

item.title: Which Radeon card should I get?
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

io9… the 9600 is a TON newer than the 9550, and I just talked with someone with a 9600, and they said it sucked. So I guess I’m gonna stick with the 9800. The Radeon 9800 is currently the best in the RXXX series.

Read full topic

item.title: Which Radeon card should I get?
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

I can’t exactly find the one I used as my main reference, but here are a few:

The Tech Report

Valve steamed over NV3x performance

SEATTLE — Greetings from ATI's "Shader Days" event, where, in a remarkable presentation, Gabe Newell of Valve, famed developers of the Half-Life series, just uncorked a shocking set of benchmarks of his company's new DirectX 9 game. Newell also...


http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_zdext/is_200309/ai_ziff61435
TechSpot

It's Half-Life 2 day! Performance revealed, NVIDIA gets hurt

A Q&A with Gabe Newell from Valve, hints on how current 3d cards will perform on HL2 and some slideshow shots from ATI's "Shader Days" event. Expect even more to come in the next days/weeks however in the meantime there…


TweakTown – 12 Sep 03

AquaMark 3 - Time for nVidia to face the reality?

In two days time Massive Development in Germany will release AquaMark 3, a fully compliant DX9 benchmark which offers gamers the ability to measure the performance of their graphics cards for the next 12 months. With all the news of poor DX9...


http://www.extremetech.com/article2/0,1697,1916993,00.asp
http://reviews.cnet.com/4520-8902_7-6213103-2.html?tag=txt (more in favor of nVidia, BUT ONLY FOR THE LOW-END CARDS! All of the cards I posted above are high-high-high end)

I’ll look for more and I’ll edit this post when I find some.

(Yes, I am planning to play HL2 and CS:S)

Basically, nVidia cards blow *** for pixel shading. They perform just as good as ATi in simple geometry setup and texturing. But they have one hell of a ****ty pixel shader engine in them. Just like everything else nVidia does, they have to cheat to get the game to run at decent speeds.

ATi builds card the good old Canadian way. Right. The pixel shaders on the DX9 series of ATi cards could blow any nVidia out of the water.

HL2 is pixel shader intensive. That’s why ATi rides the bullet to victory on this game.

Doom 3 is an OpenGL game, something that none of the Radeon cards have been that good at. Isn’t it ironic that the Doom 3 alpha was shown to the world on a Radeon 9700?

Read full topic
item.source: Which Radeon card should I get?
